availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Kenton County Court at Independence
August Term August 17th 1863

It appearing to the Satisfaction of the Court from the evidence of the Sheriff of this County that John F. Stephens, who was elected to the office of Justice of the Peace for District No 4, (Country) refuses to accept his receive from the Sheriff his Certificate of Election and Commission, and declines acting in that capacity, It is ordered that this fact be certified to his Excellency the Governor and that Biven Hemingway be recommended to him as a suitable person to fill the vacancy occasioned thereby --

A copy Att James Ayars Jr Clerk
By Wm H. Taylor D C

Kenton Co
J. P.
Dist No 4.
App Aug 27. 1863
